AdGuard for Windows ### AdGuard version . ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox ### Which device do you use? issue.title: www.twitch.tv

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: Address new Galaksion servers
issue.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/30545

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Changed only the rule with lookahead. If without lookahead, it may be risky, but for MV3
```
/^https:\/\/[0-9a-z]+\.[0-9a-z]+\.[a-z]{3,4}\/[a-z][0-9A-Za-z]{10,23}\/[A-Za-z]{5}$/$script,third-party
```

can possibly used, and for Safari
```
/^https?:\/\/([0-9a-z][0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?\.)?[0-9a-z][0-9a-z][0-9a-z][0-9a-z][0-9a-z][0-9a-z][0-9a-z][0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?[0-9a-z]?\.[a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z]?\/[a-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?[0-9A-Za-z]?\/[A-Za-z][A-Za-z][A-Za-z][A-Za-z][A-Za-z]$/$script,xhr,3p,match-case
```


### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: We also need a specific fix like `theflixertv.to#%#//scriptlet('abort-current-inline-script', 'addEventListener', 'HTMLAllCollection')`. As the number of sites using this will be large, it's best to create a dedicated section.

comment.body:
I'm not an expert on this sort of thing or any kind of a programmer. I just want the service that I pay for to work and I don't need to know how it works. I want it to work properly without me having to fix it myself. I'm not stupid, this is just not something I know a lot about.  There are many settings in there that I don't fully understand, but I'm not the developer, I'm the customer so I shouldn't have to.

I just signed into FB and it's still full of ads.  I don't think issues should be closed as completed until the customer agrees that there is a satisfactory resolution.
